In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can define the `clean_column` function within a module to keep the scope clean:

```julia
module CleanColumnModule

function clean_column(col)
    return String(replace(lowercase(col), r"^\s+|\s+$" => ""); join="_") do c
        if c == '-' || c == ' '
            '/'
        else
            c
        end
    end
end

# Example usage:
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"

end
```

This function first lowers the case of the input string, then removes any leading or trailing whitespace using a regular expression, and finally replaces spaces and hyphens with an underscore using a custom `join` function that checks for '-', ' ', or '/' characters.
